nodes.bodyText: Should this not extend a V2_0 class?
nodes.diffHunk:

See the GNU + * Lesser General Public License for more details. + */ +package org.geotools.filter.v2_0.bindings; + +import javax.xml.namespace.QName; +import org.eclipse.emf.common.util.UniqueEList; +import org.geotools.filter.v2_0.FES; +import org.opengis.filter.FilterFactory; + +/** + * Binding object for the type http://www.opengis.net/ogc:SortByType. + * + *

+ *      <xsd:sequence>

nodes.bodyText: There is some code shared beetwen v1 and v2 ( parsing method). This inheritance is used to override the target, the type and the getProperty
nodes.diffHunk:

nodes.bodyText: Is this still needed? and if it is should it be?
The code is identical between V1 and V2, so I used the class v1_1.SortOrderTypeBinding. If you prefer, I can create an empty class  v2.SortOrderTypeBinding which extends v1_1.SortOrderTypeBinding
No if they are identical then no problem, just caught my eye and have seen similar issues with this sort of mixing.
Again this should probably extend a V2_0 class
